intro: Jungia floribunda var. affinis, commonly known as the pink-flowered jungle hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warm seasons. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardens and tropical landscapes.
